alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Sabine; San Augustine; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 4:36PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Nacogdoches, southeastern Shelby, central San Augustine and northwestern Sabine Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 436 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Macune, or 25 miles southeast of Nacogdoches, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Augustine, Macune, Bland Lake, Rosevine, Patroon, Chireno, Broaddus, Denning, Sexton, Jordans Store and Chinaquapin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for eastern Texas.
